title: NSW govt considers shark safety response after four attacks within 48hrs | ABC NEWS
description: There have been four shark attacks in New South Wales over just 48 hours, placing swimmers and surfers on high alert. A surfer has survived the latest incident on the state's Mid North Coast with cuts and grazes to his legs, while another surfer remains in a critical condition after being attacked at Manly. The state government has ruled out a shark cull in response, and insists shark nets are here to stay. title: Vale Rob Hirst: Midnight Oil drummer 'key' to iconic Aussie band's story | ABC NEWS
description: Midnight Oil founding member and drummer Rob Hirst has died aged 70 following his pancreatic cancer diagnosis in 2023. Music journalist Bernard Zuel reflects on Hirst's "crucial" role in founding the iconic rock band, and the legacy of Midnight Oil in Australian music. title: More than 20 dead, dozens missing after massive Karachi mall fire | The World | ABC NEWS
description: Pakistani firefighters have started recovering bodies from the charred remains of a Karachi shopping mall where at least 21 people have died and dozens more remain missing. The city's biggest fire in over a decade had engulfed the multistorey Gul Plaza for more than 24 hours before finally being brought under control. title: Sydney protest restrictions extended with 'significantly limited' scope | ABC NEWS
description: NSW Police Commissioner Mal Lanyon has announced restrictions on protests in parts of Sydney will be extended for another two weeks, but with "limited" scope. Hyde Park has been excluded from the restricted area, allowing a planned Invasion Day rally on Australia Day to go ahead. The loosened restrictions pave the way for the March For Australia protest, also planned on Australia Day, to go ahead if other police requirements are met. title: How the Nobel Peace Prize led to a stand-off over Greenland | The World | ABC NEWS
description: In an extraordinary text message exchange between the leaders of the US and Norway, Donald Trump has linked his ambition to take control of Greenland to his failure to win the Nobel Peace Prize. As the dispute over the island threatens to ignite a trade war with Europe, the G7 countries are preparing to meet in coming days. Allan Behm, an international and security affairs advisor at The Australia Institute tells The World the situation shows "what a capricious and volatile president" Donald Trump is. #ABCTheWorld #ABCAsiaPacific  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Japan delays restart of reactor at world's biggest nuclear plant | The World | ABC NEWS
description: Japan has delayed the restart of a reactor at the world's largest nuclear power plant. The TEPCO plant was shut down after the 2011 Fukushima disaster, and is now expected to come back online in the coming days. Â It comes on the heels of a safety scandal at another Japanese nuclear plant, where it was found the operator had fudged data about earthquake risks. Dr Jeffrey Hall from Kanda University tells The World while the Fukushima disaster is still "somewhat fresh" in the minds of Japanese people, the anti-nuclear movement that followed has waned over the years. #ABCTheWorld #ABCAsiaPacific  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Australiaâ€™s â€˜ghost netsâ€™ program expands to heavily fished northern seas | ABC NEWS
description: A fight against discarded fishing nets is underway across Australia's northern coastline, with tonnes of 'ghost nets' found on remote beaches ensnaring marine life and polluting our pristine waters.  Now the Federal Government is looking beyond Australian shores, investing 25 million dollars, as part of an effort to stop nets - at the source. James Elton has this report for ABC News Northern Territory.
